newsitem.title: UK: LME copper inches up in late trading.
newsitem.headline: LME copper inches up in late trading.

text.p: LME copper inched up in late inter-office trading on Monday evening but still within its dull, familiar range.
At 1800 GMT, three months copper was quoted at $2,490/96, up from an afternoon kerb close of $2,488.
Traders said the 1,750-tonne fall in LME stocks encouraged some light speculative buying but prices baulked at seriously challenging the $2,500 resistance.
Nickel was a bit lower, indicated at $7,230/60 against a kerb close at $7,250, as the market continue to wait for developments at the strike-bound Inco Sudbury plant.
The other metals were barely changed.
